definitions.definition: The state of being relative to something else; the absence of universally applicable rules or standards ; relativism ; ( countable ) an instance of this.
Ellipsis of principle of relativity ( “ the principle that the laws of physics should be the same for all observers ” ) .

subdefinitions.definition: Also Einsteinian relativity : the reliance of the nature of physical phenomena (such as gravity , light , mass , and time ) on the relative motion between an observer and the thing observed , as developed by Albert Einstein in two theories , special relativity and general relativity .

definitions.definition: An evaluation of the similarities and differences between things; a comparison ; hence, a difference in position or status between things; a disparity .

subdefinitions.definition: The difference in pay or positions between different employees in a business ( internal relativity), or between different businesses ( external relativity); a differential .

main_definition: ( uncountable ) The state of being relative to something else; the absence of universally applicable rules or standards ; relativism ; ( countable ) an instance of this.
secondary_definitions: ( uncountable , physics ) Ellipsis of principle of relativity ( “ the principle that the laws of physics should be the same for all observers ” ) .
( countable , chiefly in the plural ) An evaluation of the similarities and differences between things; a comparison ; hence, a difference in position or status between things; a disparity .
